intro: Didelta capensis, commonly known as the Cape delta, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive leaf structure. The plant features trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically pink or purple and appear in clusters. Didelta capensis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region.
